DataElement.preferredName: Anatomic Site Integer::3 Radiation Therapy Administered Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the 3rd location on or within the human body where radiation was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
